特定保守管理医療機器のテニクニカルサポートとして、営業部と連携し機器の安定稼働のためのサービス業務全般を行う。
機器トラブルに対する電話あるいはオンサイトでのトラブルシュート、病院等オンサイトで機器据付、修理、保守点検のメンテナンス業務、引上げ修理の修理取次業務、機器の適正使用の啓蒙活動や、保守契約等のサポートを行う。
■機器のトラブル対応：修理受付、見積作成、修理作業、修理箇所分析（含：製造元とのコミュニケーション）
■機器の出荷指示、搬入、据付、納品作業
■引上げ修理の取次（代替機手配、工場とのコミュニケーションなど）
■機器の定期点検
■作業報告書・修理報告書の作成、データベース入力
■営業部への技術サポート、顧客対応サポート
■作業手順書作成・管理
■代替機器管理、物品管理
【勤務地】
全国 ―国内の転勤可能な方
（現在は、札幌、東京、名古屋、大阪、福岡ですが、拠点の拡張を予定しています）
＜職務経験＞
・医療機器業界、もしくは医療業界での業務経験がある方（2年以上）、または機器フィールドサービス経験がある方（3年以上）
※技術サポート関連業務経験がある方は尚可。
＜必要とする能力・スキル＞
・良好なコミュニケーション能力
・英文マニュアルの読解や英文でのメールのやりとりができることが望ましい。
・PC基本操作に問題がない方
・基礎事務処理能力
＜資格／免許＞
・普通自動車運転免許証
業務上車両の運転が必要となる職種については、自動車運転免許を保持している又は入社までに取得できることが条件となります。なお、道路交通法に基づく一定の症状により免許取得や更新ができなくなる可能性がある方（※）については事前にお申し出ください。
※〔確認項目〕
過去５年以内において、病気（病気の治療に伴う症状を含みます。）を原因として、又は原因は明らかでないが、意識を失ったことがある。
過去５年以内において、病気を原因として、身体の全部又は一部 が、一時的に思い通りに動かせなくなったことがある。
過去５年以内において、十分な睡眠時間を取っているにもかかわらず、日中、活動している最中に眠り込こんでしまった回数が週３回 以上となったことがある。
過去１年以内において、次のいずれかに該当したことがある。 ・飲酒を繰り返し、絶えず体にアルコールが入っている状態を３日 以上続けたことが３回以上ある。 ・病気の治療のため、医師から飲酒をやめるよう助言を受けている にもかかわらず、飲酒したことが３回以上ある。
・病気を理由として、医師から、運転免許の取得又は運転を控えるよう助言を受けている。
＜学歴＞
・電気、工学系、もしくは高専出身であればなおよい。
【求める人物像】
・社内外のコミュニケーション力がある人
・技術だけでなく、ビジネスマンとして行動できる人。
・セルフスタ－ター、セルフモチベーター
・コンプライアントに活動できる人
・チームワークを重視できる人

JOB TITLE: Senior Scientist, Parallel Medicinal Chemistry - Discovery Chemistry
job_title: Senior Scientist, Parallel Medicinal Chemistry - Discovery Chemistry
job_description: Janssen Research & Development, L.L.C., a division of Johnson & Johnson's Family of Companies is recruiting for a Senior Scientist, Parallel Medicinal Chemistry in Discovery Chemistry, for our site in Spring House, PA. At the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, what matters most is helping people live full and healthy lives. We focus on treating, curing and preventing some of the most devastating and complex diseases of our time. And we pursue the most promising science, wherever it might be found. Janssen Research & Development, LLC discovers and develops innovative medical solutions to address important unmet medical needs in oncology, immunology, neuroscience, infectious diseases and vaccines, and cardiovascular and metabolic diseases. Please visit http://www.janssenrnd.com/ for more information. We are Janssen. Our mission drives us. Our patients inspire us. We collaborate with the world for the health of everyone in it. Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer. The newly formed Discovery Chemistry group is committed to the delivery of high quality drug candidates working with all six Janssen Therapeutic Areas (TAs). This mission requires deep scientific expertise in a number of disciplines including chemistry, cellular and molecular pharmacology, enzymology, and screening technologies coupled with an ability to work collaboratively with internal and external partners. Building on a strong legacy of success, we are currently seeking an outstanding individual to join our team as Senior Scientist, Parallel Medicinal Chemistry, Discovery Chemistry. This position will be based at our drug discovery site in Spring House, PA. We are seeking an experienced medicinal chemist with parallel synthesis expertise to advance small molecule drug discovery programs toward the clinic. In this laboratory-based position, the successful candidate will partner with both internal and external medicinal chemistry teams to generate innovative solutions to synthetic and medicinal chemistry challenges within the context of small molecule drug discovery projects. She/he will maintain close interactions with computer assisted design scientists, biologists, pharmacologists, and pharmaceutical development scientists. Strong people skills and the ability to thrive in a team and goal driven environment are key attributes. This individual must also excel in communication and have strong interpersonal skills necessary to influence in a collaborative multidisciplinary environment.
Responsibilities of the Senior Scientist include:

Maintaining a high level of productivity in the laboratory setting.Lead collaborations with medicinal chemistry teams, computational chemists and therapeutic area biologists to apply automated chemistry capabilities, such as parallel medicinal chemistry, modern catalysis screen, High throughput Experimentation (HTE) and High Throughput Purification (HTP) to accelerate Discovery programs Supervise and direct automated chemistry and medicinal chemistry activities internally and/or at contract research organizations (CROs) Analyze screening data, perform literature reviews, design, propose, and execute medicinal chemistry plans, coordinate chemistry and biology data to support compound progression and patent strategiesServe as a scientific expert in parallel medicinal chemistry with both internal and external partners and provide recommendations regarding new targets, new synthetic strategies and emerging external chemistry capabilities.Ensure optimal interaction/communication and provide updates on project status to Discovery leadershipDrafting, executing and serving as lead author on research published in peer reviewed journals, and presenting work at scientific conferences.
Maintaining a high level of productivity in the laboratory setting.

Lead collaborations with medicinal chemistry teams, computational chemists and therapeutic area biologists to apply automated chemistry capabilities, such as parallel medicinal chemistry, modern catalysis screen, High throughput Experimentation (HTE) and High Throughput Purification (HTP) to accelerate Discovery programs
Supervise and direct automated chemistry and medicinal chemistry activities internally and/or at contract research organizations (CROs)
Analyze screening data, perform literature reviews, design, propose, and execute medicinal chemistry plans, coordinate chemistry and biology data to support compound progression and patent strategies

Serve as a scientific expert in parallel medicinal chemistry with both internal and external partners and provide recommendations regarding new targets, new synthetic strategies and emerging external chemistry capabilities.
Ensure optimal interaction/communication and provide updates on project status to Discovery leadership
Drafting, executing and serving as lead author on research published in peer reviewed journals, and presenting work at scientific conferences.

PhD in synthetic organic or medicinal chemistry is requiredPostdoctoral experience is preferred At least 3 or more years of experience at a pharmaceutical industry in medicinal chemistry Is required.In-depth knowledge and extensive experience in parallel medicinal chemistry and/or high throughput experimentation (HTE) is required. Strong track record of achievement in the synthesis of complex molecules and/or synthetic methodology development, with deep knowledge of modern synthetic & analytical techniques is required.Proven track record of scientific contributions including peer reviewed publications, patents and presentations is required.Experience with computational chemistry methods and biophysical techniques such as X-ray crystallography is preferred.Independent thinking and the ability to effectively collaborate in a highly matrixed environment is required.Excellent oral and written communication skills, including preparation of presentations is required.Up to 5% travel is required. De (sr) Manufacturing Process Specialist voert de werkzaamheden uit binnen Operations Bioprocessing of Operations Bioprocessing Services. De kerntaken omvatten het introduceren, onderhouden en verbeteren van productieprocessen en processen die

ondersteunend zijn aan de productieprocessen. Waar een process nieuw equipment behoeft zal de Manufacturing Process Specialist een zwaarwegende rol spelen bij de introductie van dat nieuwe equipment : het eigenaarschap van het equipment wordt dan op een later moment overgedragen.
De Manufacturing Process Specialist is eigenaar van een process (of meerdere processen) :

Binnen Bioprocessing ligt de nadruk op primaire productieprocessen (in de eiwitlijn van WCB t/m de (Pre)Formulated Bulk;Binnen Bioprocessing Services ligt de nadruk op ondersteunende processen zoals media preparation, buffer preparation en equipment preparation.

Caring for the world, one person at a time has inspired and united the people of Johnson & Johnson for over 130 years. We embrace research and science -- bringing innovative ideas, products and services to advance the health and well-being of people.

With $76.5 billion in 2017 sales, Johnson & Johnson is the world's most comprehensive and broadly-based manufacturer of health care products, as well as a provider of related services, for the consumer, pharmaceutical, and medical devices markets. There are more than 250 Johnson & Johnson operating companies employing over 125,000 people and with products touching the lives of over a billion people every day, throughout the world. If you have the talent and desire to touch the world, Johnson & Johnson has the career opportunities to help make it happen.
Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

There are more than 200 operating companies in Johnson & Johnson, and we employ approximately 120,000 employees in over 55 countries around the world, selling products in more than 175 countries.

Janssen Research & Development, L.L.C., a division of Johnson & Johnson's Family of Companies is recruiting for a Senior Associate Scientist, Biochemistry/Biophysics, to be located in Spring House, PA.

At the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, what matters most is helping people live full and healthy lives. The new Lead Discovery team is a critical part of the Discovery Sciences (DS) organization in Janssen R&D;, and is committed to the delivery of high quality chemical leads needed for the generation of small molecule clinical compounds in all five Janssen Therapeutic Area (TA) discovery teams. This mission requires deep scientific expertise in a number of disciplines including chemistry, cellular and molecular pharmacology, enzymology, and screening technologies coupled with an ability to work collaboratively with internal and external partners. Building on a strong legacy of success, we are currently seeking an outstanding individual to join our team as Senior Associate Scientist in Biochemistry/Biophysics. This position will report to a senior member of the Molecular & Cellular Pharmacology Group, and be based in Spring House, PA.

S/he will collaborate in a highly multidisciplinary/matrix environment for the progression of drug discovery projects.

In order of importance, briefly describe, in sentence form, the essential functions/major responsibilities of this position (principal duties and responsibilities of the position) as it exists today. Describe the job, not the person in the job. Each item listed below should be an essential function/major responsibility of the position, not a day-to-day activity. -Acts as liaison among colleagues within C&G;(Contract and Grants ) and study teams to assist with issue resolution and/or guidance, as needed.

-Answer queries, questions and issue resolution with sites and study teams, as needed.

-Request and gain access to study-specific EDC(electronic data capture) system.
-Run monthly subject visit completion reports and enter data in to CTMS.
-Generate payments through CTMS, where applicable. Enter invoices upon receipt.

JOB TITLE: Scientist, Computational Chemistry - South San Francisco, CA
job_title: Scientist, Computational Chemistry - South San Francisco, CA
job_description: Janssen Research & Development, a Johnson & Johnson Company is recruiting for a Scientist in Computational Chemistry located at South San Francisco, California.

The Discovery Sciences organization within Janssen R&D; is continuing to build key scientific expertise in screening, pharmacology and chemistry to partner closely with therapeutic area scientists to develop groundbreaking new medicines in the areas of Oncology, Immunology, Neuroscience, Cardiovascular, and Infectious Diseases. We are seeking excellent drug discovery scientists to join the team to bring their expertise to exciting efforts in novel areas of drug discovery.

At the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, what matters most is helping people live full and stabilized lives. We focus on treating, curing and preventing some of the most devastating and complex diseases of our time. We strive for partnership, and that has led to numerous breakthroughs. This includes medical miracles that have changed lives, to the simple consumer products that make every single day a little better. Our over 125,000 employees in 60 countries stand united in a common mission: To help people everywhere live longer, healthier, happier lives. Growing on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to diversity. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

As a Scientist, you will apply computational methods, including structure-based drug design, homology modeling, QSAR, ligand/receptor docking, high-throughput virtual screening (HTVS), molecular dynamics, quantum methods and diversity/similarity analysis and machine learning/artificial intelligence (ML/AI) in the design of individual molecules and libraries. Your goal is to advance various drug discovery projects. You will participate in multi-disciplinary teams including chemists, biologists, and structural biologists providing key expertise in the use and interpretation of structural data related to drug targets and their ligands/inhibitors. You will be responsible for:

Execution of sophisticated experiments using advanced computational techniques on UNIX-based computer workstations.You should be able to clearly communication the results of computational experiments and interpretations of structure to team members facilitating the discovery of new drugs.Development of novel computational methods to address key drug discovery questions.
Execution of sophisticated experiments using advanced computational techniques on UNIX-based computer workstations.
You should be able to clearly communication the results of computational experiments and interpretations of structure to team members facilitating the discovery of new drugs.

JOB TITLE: POST-DOCTORAL FELLOW, MACHINE LEARNING FOR COMPUTER-AIDED DRUG DESIGN
job_title: POST-DOCTORAL FELLOW, MACHINE LEARNING FOR COMPUTER-AIDED DRUG DESIGN
job_description: Caring for the world, one person at a time has inspired and united the people of Johnson & Johnson for over 130 years. We embrace research and science -- bringing innovative ideas, products and services to advance the health and well-being of people. With $76.5 billion in 2017 sales, Johnson & Johnson is the world's most comprehensive and broadly-based manufacturer of health care products, as well as a provider of related services, for the consumer, pharmaceutical, and medical devices markets. There are more than 250 Johnson & Johnson operating companies employing over 125,000 people and with products touching the lives of over a billion people every day, throughout the world. If you have the talent and desire to touch the world, Johnson & Johnson has the career opportunities to help make it happen. Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Developing innovative therapeutics to treat diseases like Alzheimer’s disease, various types of cancers and infectious diseases like Hepatitis B, influenza is our passion. In this endeavor, we are seeking to recruit new talent for the comprehensive analyses of high-dimensional datasets using state-of-the-art data science methods applied to drug discovery programs. The position is opened at Spring House (PA), a headquarters of Janssen Research & Development. We significantly increased our investment into the workforce for data analysis pipelines with the emphasis in current cutting-edge technologies to support future Artificial Intelligence-driven drug design and discovery.

Janssen Research & Development L.L.C., is looking for the 2-year postdoctoral fellow to support drug design and discovery projects using machine learning approaches with emphasis on transfer learning and deep learning. Deep learning techniques have already shown promise for small molecule projects in Janssen, yet most of those models require a significant amount of data, while many of the ADMETox-related pipelines generate significantly smaller datasets that require transfer learning to integrate them successfully into the predictive pipelines.

This position will support small molecule design and optimization using machine learning techniques by integrating millions of data points coming from heterogeneous data sources: chemical structure, microscopy images, and various omics experiments. The primary goal is the improvement of the predictive pipelines to increase safety and efficacy of the drug candidates and decrease the time needed to progress hit compound to lead compound to compound in clinical trials.

Main responsibilities would include the development of predictive models and their testing in real projects that would require interaction with chemists, biologists, and data scientist and further model optimization if needed. We are looking for candidates with a track record in deep learning and preferably experience working with chemical or biological data.

Support drug design and development using cutting edge machine learning techniques;Design and development of the transfer learning pipelines for small and medium size datasets (SMSDS) from scratch (Keras, TensorFlow, etc.) or adaptation of the open source code if available; Finding the beneficial interplay of the transfer learning on large datasets (millions of compounds by thousands of biological end-point types) to small and medium size datasets reflecting ADMET assays (thousands of end-points per assay); Building machine learning models that effectively learn from heterogenous multi-modal data, e.g. modeling biological effects of compounds on the basis of chemical structure and gene expression, high content image descriptors or other omics dataApplication of the developed pipelines in drug design and development project with actionable conclusions;Integration of the pipelines into internal expert system together with end-users (chemists, biologists, data scientists) and IT support: to promote transparency, traceability and visual component of the developed technique.Contributing to the scientific weight of the department by authoring peer-reviewed papers and presenting at relevant conferences.
Support drug design and development using cutting edge machine learning techniques;
Design and development of the transfer learning pipelines for small and medium size datasets (SMSDS) from scratch (Keras, TensorFlow, etc.) or adaptation of the open source code if available;

Finding the beneficial interplay of the transfer learning on large datasets (millions of compounds by thousands of biological end-point types) to small and medium size datasets reflecting ADMET assays (thousands of end-points per assay);

Building machine learning models that effectively learn from heterogenous multi-modal data, e.g. modeling biological effects of compounds on the basis of chemical structure and gene expression, high content image descriptors or other omics data
Application of the developed pipelines in drug design and development project with actionable conclusions;

Integration of the pipelines into internal expert system together with end-users (chemists, biologists, data scientists) and IT support: to promote transparency, traceability and visual component of the developed technique.
Contributing to the scientific weight of the department by authoring peer-reviewed papers and presenting at relevant conferences.

Preferably PhD in Computer Science, Data Science, Computational chemistry, Bioinformatics or a related quantitative field, preferably with experience of interaction with research chemists or biologists in an academic or industrial setting or equivalent experience
Advanced programming skills to enable the development of functional prototypes
Experience with Deep Learning machine learning frameworks, like PyTorch, Keras, Tensorflow or alike
Excellent communication, reporting and team interaction skills, self-motivation, proactivity and the ability to work independently
A passion for hands-on science and delivering high quality results in the lab.
Good communication, organizing, and planning skills and the ability to take leadership for and drive decision making in a research project.
Ability to develop and deliver a presentation on technical data with strong business impact.

Creative mind that is able to see things from different perspectives and come up with innovative solutions to complex problems. Ability to introduce best practices from previous work experiences into the new team.
Desire for continuous learning and the ability to identify, evaluate and implement emerging areas of science.

The Targeted Therapeutics group is a part of Discovery Sciences in Janssen R&D; and is engaged in developing novel therapeutics that require intracellular and tissue specific delivery, across the modality spectrum (including small molecules, biologics and nucleic acids) in partnership with Janssen therapeutic area teams. We are currently looking for a talented, highly-motivated, and technically competent Bioconjugation Scientist to become part of our team. The successful candidate will have a background in protein chemistry, biochemistry, or a related field with a record of achieving technology development and research goals on aggressive timelines through effective cross-functional collaboration. S/he should have significant experience in discovery or development of targeted therapeutics such as antibody and other protein conjugates, nucleic acid conjugates, and/or protein-nanomaterial conjugates (e.g. lipid or polymeric nanoparticles, micelles, dendrimers), as well as analytical characterization of these products. Prior experience in protein handling and purification at different scales is highly desirable.

As a member of a cross-functional project team, collaborate with the therapeutic areas and other groups to define targeting strategies and provide stage-appropriate molecules for preclinical studies.Independently contribute with minimal supervision from the bench (design and execution of studies, critical analysis of data, presentation of results) to multiple research projects and provide critical data to inform decisions in a cross-functional team. Innovate to manage complex research plans and deliver business results. A Senior Scientist may be asked to supervise other scientists to accomplish tasks and project objectivesKeep abreast of new technologies/capabilities relevant to this role and strive to implement them to push research projects forward.Author data summaries, technical reports, standard operating procedures, publications, and presentations.

job_description: Johnson and Johnson is committed to eliminate lung cancer via solutions that prevent, intercept and cure. This vision is enabled by Johnson & Johnson’s state-of-the-art capabilities in delivering consumer, medical devices, diagnostics and pharmaceutical solutions to lung cancer patients. A cross sector Lung Cancer Initiative was formed to leverage unparalleled depth and breadth of expertise within Johnson and Johnson and its close connection with external innovation to take a holistic approach to lung cancer.

LCI China is recruiting for a program leader who will be a key member of a core team to execute China strategy. The position requires close collaboration across Johnson & Johnson’s business sectors including pharmaceuticals, medical devices, diagnostics, and consumer divisions to advance the Center’s strategy. The LCI China program leader will lead multi-disciplinary program teams to ensure successful delivery of program goals.

· Technical expertise in medical device and/or pharmaceutical science is preferred and knowledge in lung cancer diagnostics and/or treatment is a plus
Job Description
Position: Senior Scientist, Biomarker Research
DESCRIPTION

The successful candidate will join a multidisciplinary research organization focusing on drug discovery, translational research, and early development of novel small or large molecule drug candidates in Shanghai, China. This job may include expanding and strengthening the company’s internal and external network, research project coordination, out sourcing to CROs, biomarker project initiation and execution, biomarker platform set up and management. This position works closely with drug discovery, translational research, and early development team on biomarker development to support discovery research and clinical development of new compound in the pipeline. The successful candidate should have a well-established track record in scientific research, ideally in pharmaceutical R&D; or other healthcare industry. Good communication skills in both English and Chinese, as well as an ability to interact with collaboration partners both internally and externally.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
· Solid scientific background in translational/biomarker research is required. Proactive participation and contribution to scientific community within JNJ will be expected.

· The successful candidate may be actively engaged in participating and evaluating progress in collaborative programs with external partners, so experience in collaborative research would be desirable.

The successful candidate is expected to manage state-of-the-art flow cytometry facility, responsible for design, development, qualification/validation of various flow cytometry-based assays, and data analysis/interpretation, to support discovery and biomarker research.

The successful candidate is expected to manage state-of-the-art flow cytometry facility, responsible for design, development, qualification/validation of various flow cytometry-based assays, and data analysis/interpretation, to support discovery and biomarker research.
· The successful candidate will be expected to work efficiently in a multi-task environment, and to supervise junior scientists to deliver hands-on work according to priorities and timelines.

The candidate should have a PhD in biology, molecular/cell biology, immunology, or a related field, with minimum five years of industry experience in pre-clinical drug discovery or translational research, preferably in a pharmaceutical setting or other relevant healthcare industry. A strong background in immunology is required Hands on experience with FACS assay development and data analysis is required

JOB TITLE: Senior Scientist, Drug Metabolism And Pharmacokinetics (DMPK)
job_title: Senior Scientist, Drug Metabolism and Pharmacokinetics (DMPK)
job_description: Janssen Pharmaceuticals Companies of Johnson & Johnson is recruiting for a Senior Scientist – Drug Metabolism and Pharmacokinetics (DMPK), located in South San Francisco, CA.

Janssen Pharmaceuticals Companies of Johnson & Johnson are dedicated to addressing and solving the most important unmet medical needs of our time, including infectious disease, immunology, neuroscience, oncology and cardiovascular and metabolic diseases. Driven by our commitment to patients, we develop sustainable, integrated healthcare solutions by working side-by-side with healthcare stakeholders, based on partnerships of trust and transparency.

The successful candidate will work closely with Discovery teams to provide timely and seamless delivery of quality data to guide drug candidate selection. The responsibilities will include setting up in vitro ADME strategies to identify and address DMPK liabilities, development and execution of Tier 2 and mechanistic ADME assays (e.g. reaction phenotyping, enzyme kinetics, inhibition and induction experiments, plasma and tissue protein binding) to support discovery and preclinical development portfolio. Additionally, he/she will oversee outsourcing of Tier 1 ADME assays, conduct research to identify new predictive techniques and assays and mentor junior laboratory staff. The candidate will collaborate with counterparts at other Janssen sites to ensure global implementation of best practices and to maintain a high level of productivity.

A completed PhD in Pharmaceutical Sciences with a minimum of 5 years of relevant industry experience, OR a completed MS degree in Pharmaceutical Sciences with at least 10 years of relevant industry experience is required. Strong understanding of DMPK principles and prior experience in supporting drug discovery, with broad hands-on experience in techniques for in vitro ADME profiling of small molecules, ADME assay automation and LC-MS quantitation are required. Hands-on experience with large molecules will be a plus. The candidate must possess excellent interpersonal, organizational, oral/written communication and teamwork skills. This position is located in South San Francisco, CA and may require approximately 10% travel.

JOB TITLE: POSTDOCTORAL FELLOW, NOVEL BIOCONJUGATION - TARGETED THERAPEUTICS
job_title: POSTDOCTORAL FELLOW, NOVEL BIOCONJUGATION - TARGETED THERAPEUTICS
job_description: Postdoctoral Fellow, Novel Bioconjugation – Targeted Therapeutics

Caring for the world, one person at a time has inspired and united the people of Johnson & Johnson for over 130 years. We embrace research and science -- bringing innovative ideas, products and services to advance the health and well-being of people.

With $76.5 billion in 2017 sales, Johnson & Johnson is the world's most comprehensive and broadly-based manufacturer of health care products, as well as a provider of related services, for the consumer, pharmaceutical, and medical devices markets. There are more than 250 Johnson & Johnson operating companies employing over 125,000 people and with products touching the lives of over a billion people every day, throughout the world. If you have the talent and desire to touch the world, Johnson & Johnson has the career opportunities to help make it happen.

Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.
Janssen Research & Development, LLC., a Johnson and Johnson Company is hiring a Postdoctoral Fellow to be located in Spring House, PA.

The Targeted Therapeutics group is a part of Discovery Sciences in Janssen R&D; and is engaged in developing cutting edge therapeutics across the modality spectrum (including small molecules, biologics and nucleic acids) that require intracellular and tissue specific delivery, in partnership with Janssen therapeutic area teams. We are recruiting a Postdoctoral Fellow, Novel Bioconjugation to join our team.

Bioconjugation is a key enabling technology for the development of new cell-targeted therapeutics to address unmet medical needs. The postdoctoral fellow will work within the Targeted Therapeutics team and in collaboration with the Therapeutic Areas to discover and develop new bioconjugation approaches with the potential to later advance these conjugates as drug candidates. The fellow will be expected to publish in peer-reviewed journals. S/he will have scientific interactions with the Discovery organization including giving and attending seminars and scientific meetings and participating in symposia.

The successful candidate will have a background in protein and/or conjugation chemistry, biochemistry, or a related field. S/he will have demonstrated deep intellectual curiosity and creativity as well a track record of achieving research goals and an ability to independently design and execute research.
· A PhD in Chemistry, Biochemistry, Chemical/Biomedical Engineering, or related field
· A solid research publication record
· Experience with protein biochemistry, protein purification, bioconjugation methods, and/or biophysical characterization
· Experience with biomolecule purification using automated chromatography systems is preferred
· Interest and ability to work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, and be capable of handling multiple tasks
· Candidate must be detail-oriented, highly organized and able to manage multiple tasks.
· Candidates must have the ability to work individually (independently) as well as on a team.
· Candidates must be available to work Full-time.
· Candidates must be legally authorized to work in the United States and not require sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g. H1-B status) now or in the future.
· Demonstrated leadership is preferred.
Vision Care, a Johnson & Johnson company based in Limerick are currently recruiting Process Technicians to support our 24/7 fully automated manufacturing facility.

Vision Care Ireland is located in Limerick and produces the world’s leading contact lens product: the Acuvue range of lenses. Our site uses the industry’s most advanced technology and directly employs over 1000 people. We produce a diverse array of contact lenses using our highly automated production process. Key to our success has been the combination of state-of-the-art material science with technologies such as precision injection moulding, robotics, vision systems and data analytics.

Vision Care Ireland was established in 1995 in the National Technology Park, close to the University of Limerick. We have over 37 advanced production lines, manufacturing over 8 million contact lenses a day, which are shipped to customers worldwide.
· Using state of the art IT and software resources, to analyse data and feedback from the line
· Identifying cycle time and yield detractors
· Using your own initiative to make the necessary adjustments and modifications to the line improving output
· Working with your team and the engineering teams, to root cause and problem solve issues
· Supporting planned and unplanned downtime on the line, to ensure a speedy return to production
· Replacing and setting up spare parts including, robots, servo drives, vision systems, and pneumatics

Our Process Technicians are critical to running our high volume, automated manufacturing process. Technicians who have the interest, energy and motivation to work in our fast moving, medical devices manufacturing environment will find themselves a rewarding permanent role with Vision Care. You will take ownership of:
· Production output of a Class III Medical Device
· Equipment Maintenance (controls, sensors, pneumatics & electrics)
· Line efficiency (high volume production and fully automated manufacturing)
· Project work (relating to process improvement including cycle-time and yield development)
· Contribution to targets related to Safety, Quality, Compliance and Continuous Improvement

This is an opportunity to work at the cutting edge of medical device engineering, in an FDA regulated environment, and to be a member of a Johnson & Johnson company with an excellent record in employee continuous professional development and business continuous improvement.

We are passionate about our work; we play vital roles across a range of professional disciplines and care deeply about our customers and communities. At Johnson & Johnson our culture enables dynamic and impactful careers. We share a kind of DNA where we’re each:
· Responsible to our customers and communities.
· Ready to apply our knowledge and know-how.
· Unique in our background and experiences.
· The drivers of our own success.
· Passionate about doing what’s right.
· Seeking to learn and teach.

· We seek technicians who have the interest, energy and motivation to work in our fast moving, medical devices manufacturing environment.
· Applicants should have experience of working within a team, have excellent communication skills and be able to work under their own initiative.

JOB TITLE: Principal Scientist, PK/PD Modeling And Simulation
job_title: Principal Scientist, PK/PD Modeling and Simulation
job_description: You will assist in driving preclinical Pharmacokinetic/ Pharmacodynamic (PK/PD) strategies and human dose predictions from early discovery to First in Human (FIH) acting as the key point of contact for PK/PD strategies for preclinical discovery teams. You will be expected to collaborate with the therapeutic areas, interfacing between DMPK and other discovery (chemistry, biology, safety) and development colleagues to help guide the appropriate in vitro and in vivo ADME studies as well as the design of in vivo PK/PD studies with the goal of providing guidance for the human efficacious and starting dose for lead candidates in early discovery and development. Such approaches include (but will not be limited to) physiologically based pharmacokinetic (PBPK) approaches (Simcyp, Gastroplus and similar software), systems PK (Matlab, JDesigner, Simbiology and similar software) , and classical PK/PD approaches (Nonmem, Monolix, Winnonlin and similar software) to help (a) predict human PK profile (b) quantify the exposure / response relationship needed to quantify “efficacy” and to guide dose selection (c) help guide in vivo experimental design of both PK exposure studies as well as pharmacodynamic end points (d) help quantify and de-risk any exposure related AE issues (e) help determine quantifiable in vitro in vivo extrapolation relationships across lead series.

You will assist in driving preclinical Pharmacokinetic/ Pharmacodynamic (PK/PD) strategies and human dose predictions from early discovery to First in Human (FIH) acting as the key point of contact for PK/PD strategies for preclinical discovery teams.

You will be expected to collaborate with the therapeutic areas, interfacing between DMPK and other discovery (chemistry, biology, safety) and development colleagues to help guide the appropriate in vitro and in vivo ADME studies as well as the design of in vivo PK/PD studies with the goal of providing guidance for the human efficacious and starting dose for lead candidates in early discovery and development. Such approaches include (but will not be limited to) physiologically based pharmacokinetic (PBPK) approaches (Simcyp, Gastroplus and similar software), systems PK (Matlab, JDesigner, Simbiology and similar software) , and classical PK/PD approaches (Nonmem, Monolix, Winnonlin and similar software) to help (a) predict human PK profile (b) quantify the exposure / response relationship needed to quantify “efficacy” and to guide dose selection (c) help guide in vivo experimental design of both PK exposure studies as well as pharmacodynamic end points (d) help quantify and de-risk any exposure related AE issues (e) help determine quantifiable in vitro in vivo extrapolation relationships across lead series.

PhD in Pharmacology or Engineering or Mathematics or Physics, and related fields with a specific focus on pharmacological modeling with a minimum of 5 years of relevant industry experience are required. A strong understanding of DMPK principles and experience in supporting drug discovery are required. Nonmem or Monolix software experience is preferred. Proven skills in modeling and simulation, supported by a publication track record is preferred. Excellent interpersonal, organizational, oral/written communication and teamwork skills are required.

job_title: Associate Scientist II, Bioconjugation – Targeted Therapeutics
job_description: Janssen Research & Development, L.L.C., a division of Johnson & Johnson's Family of Companies is recruiting for Associate Scientist II, Bioconjugation – Targeted Therapeutics, Discovery Sciences, for our site in Spring House, PA.

At the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, what matters most is helping people live full and healthy lives. We focus on treating, curing and preventing some of the most devastating and complex diseases of our time. And we pursue the most promising science, wherever it might be found.

Janssen Research & Development, LLC discovers and develops innovative medical solutions to address important unmet medical needs in oncology, immunology, neuroscience, infectious diseases and vaccines, and cardiovascular and metabolic diseases. Please visit http://www.janssenrnd.com/ for more information.
We are Janssen. Our mission drives us. Our patients inspire us. We collaborate with the world for the health of everyone in it.
Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

The Targeted Therapeutics group is a part of Discovery Sciences in Janssen R&D; and is engaged in developing cutting edge therapeutics that require intracellular and tissue specific delivery, across the modality spectrum (including small molecules, biologics and nucleic acids) in partnership with Janssen therapeutic area teams. In this position, the Associate Scientist will contribute to a team working on design and characterization of drug candidates such as antibody conjugates and nucleic acid conjugates. This scientist will primarily be responsible for conjugation of antibodies, proteins, and peptides to a variety of payloads; purification of these conjugates using standard chromatography methods; and characterization of the molecules with a variety of bioanalytical tools. The scientist will be expected to coordinate with team members to assist in design and characterization of molecules, and collaborate with therapeutic areas and other groups to advance projects. Additional responsibilities may include laboratory management duties such as maintaining lab instruments and training other scientists.

A minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree in biotechnology, biochemistry, molecular biology or a related field with at least 5 or more years of laboratory experience is required ORA minimum of a Master’s Degree with at least 3 or more years of laboratory experience is required Laboratory experience in one or more of the following areas is required: protein purificationprotein chemistrybiochemical analysisExperience with the following techniques is required:biomolecule purification using automated chromatography systemsconjugation chemistry and purification methodsAdditionally, the following skills are highly desired:protein characterization analytical chromatographybiophysical methodsMass spectrometry

Caring for the world, one person at a time has inspired and united the people of Johnson & Johnson for over 130 years. We embrace research and science -- bringing innovative ideas, products and services to advance the health and well-being of people.

With $76.5 billion in 2017 sales, Johnson & Johnson is the world's most comprehensive and broadly-based manufacturer of health care products, as well as a provider of related services, for the consumer, pharmaceutical, and medical devices markets. There are more than 250 Johnson & Johnson operating companies employing over 125,000 people and with products touching the lives of over a billion people every day, throughout the world. If you have the talent and desire to touch the world, Johnson & Johnson has the career opportunities to help make it happen.
Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
Ethicon, a member of Johnson & Johnson’s family of companies located in Somerville, NJ, is recruiting for R&D; Co-ops for Fall 2019.

Ethicon, Inc. based in Somerville, New Jersey, was founded more than 80 years ago as a pioneer in suture development and manufacturing, helping to transform the safety and effectiveness of open surgery. The Ethicon business offers a broad range of products, platforms and technologies including— sutures, hemostasis products, surgical staplers, trocars, energy devices and synthetic mesh devices—that are used in a wide variety of minimally-invasive and open surgical procedures. Specialties include support for treatment of colorectal and thoracic conditions, women's health conditions, hernias, oncology, and obesity.
Positions are available in many subgroups of R&D; and may include some or all of the following responsibilities:

You will be part of an Information Security and Risk Management (ISRM) team with global responsibility for Johnson & Johnson’s on-premises Active Directory and Azure Active Directories and related systems which provide authentication and authorization services in our office, manufacturing, laboratory, warehousing and distribution environments. You will participate in the definition, design, test and implementation, typically via scripting and automation, of AD, AAD and O365 solutions, security and identity and access controls.
Key responsibilities:
· Partner with Scripting and Automation Manager to provide scripting and programming services to the entire Enterprise Directories Engineering team

· Maintain, enhance, extend and secure configurations of third-party COTS tools and custom automation used to provision, manage and deprovision Active Directory and Azure Active objects in line with business processes
· Interface tools with other IT systems to enable end-to-end automation
· Collaborate with partners and customers (typically in other InfoSec and IT teams) to clarify business requirements prior to designing and implementing solutions
· Build security into all designs and solutions from the outset
· Work to company and team standards for development processes, tooling, incident, problem, change and release management
· Create and maintain documentation for designs, tests and operational support
· Transition implemented solutions to operational support, training support personnel
· Monitor industry landscape to help shape Directory Services Automation strategies
· Provide Level 3 support (incl. on-call rota covering outside business hours) for entire portfolio of Enterprise Directory Services
· A Bachelors’ Degree or equivalent preferably in an Engineering or other technical discipline
· A minimum of 5 years of professional work experience in Enterprise IT with:
Strong Windows Systems Engineering experience especially with Windows SecurityDemonstrable Active Directory administration experienceStrong troubleshooting skills
Strong Windows Systems Engineering experience especially with Windows SecurityDemonstrable Active Directory administration experienceStrong troubleshooting skills
Strong Windows Systems Engineering experience especially with Windows Security
Demonstrable Active Directory administration experience
Strong troubleshooting skills
· Strong scripting (essential: PowerShell &.NET) and programming (C#, Javascript, etc.)
· Strong SQL and LDAP experience; some experience of SQL Server implementation
· Demonstrable experience of working with Source Code Control (e.g. git/Bitbucket)
· Demonstrable understanding of IT Security principles and practices
· Desirable: experience customizing Quest AD tools (e.g. ARS, Enterprise Reporter) or NetIQ DRA
· Ability to work across time-zones in global teams with corresponding work-hours flexibility
· Ability to work independently, self-start and prioritize work per agreement with manager
· Ability to influence without authority and communicate to all levels of management
· Ability to problem-solve business issues as well as technical problems

· A sense of urgency with strong results orientation

Johnson & Johnson Consumer Inc., a member of Johnson & Johnson's Family of Companies, is recruiting a Post-Doc – Baby Innovation Platform, Behavior Change. Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies touches more than a billion people’s lives each day through our health care products and services, our corporate giving, and the volunteer efforts of our employees. The Johnson & Johnson Group of Consumer Companies develop and market beloved brands that address the needs of consumers and health care professionals worldwide. Our portfolio ranges across several distinct business units: Baby Care, Oral Care, Compromised Skin Care, Beauty, Feminine Care, and Over-The-Counter (OTC) products.

The Post-Doc will be responsible for projects related to behavior change in the baby care space, including developing routines and experiences to promote happy, healthy child development and promote maternal health and well-being. This individual will work on upstream innovation in the Global Baby Platform, specifically focused on uncovering new scientific and consumer insights, developing new methodologies, assessment of technologies, and conducting clinical studies. In addition to basic research, this individual will test and help scale real-world applications for behavior change, especially in the area of digital technologies and devices. The Post-Doc will be expected to apply expertise in experimental design, advanced statistical skills, and enthusiasm for creating products, services, and experiences to enhance baby care.

Position Title: Senior Automation Engineer
Department: Engineering
Report to: Engineering Manager
Location: Limerick
Company Summary:

Johnson & Johnson Vision Care Ireland is located in Limerick and produces the Acuvue range of contact lenses which is the leading contact lens product in the world. Our Limerick site uses the most advanced technology in the industry and we now employ over 900 people directly. Using our highly automated production process, we produce daily disposable contact lenses while utilizing state of the art technologies such as injection moulding, robotics, vision systems and sterilisation systems.

Johnson & Johnson Vision Care Ireland was established in 1995 in the National Technology Park close to the University of Limerick. The facility was originally fitted with six advanced production lines to manufacture one daily disposable contact lens for the European and Japanese markets. Since then we have expanded a number of times and now have over 31 production lines manufacturing one-day, fortnightly, monthly and colour contact lenses which are shipped worldwide.

Each year, we have increased output because of the increase demand for our Acuvue lenses throughout the world Continued expansion of our product lines and extensive engineering and retrofit projects ensure that this growth is sustained well into the future.
Position Summary:

Develop, test and install control system software changes with supporting documentation for validated manufacturing systems. Provide support to operations for automation related issues on the production lines.
Main duties and responsibilities:

· Responsible for development, installation and support of PLC controlled automation software projects within a highly automated validated manufacturing plant using the following equipment:PLCs (Siemens APT and S7, Pilz PSS WIN-PRO, Allen Bradley RSLogix5000, Mitsubishi GX IEC Developer, SCADA (Wonderware 9.5 and ArchestrA), Robots (Mitsubishi Melfa Eng) and Vision Systems (Cognex, Neurocheck Perceptics).
· Provide ideas and solutions for the improvement and development of control systems
· Participates on and may lead project teams, and provide technical support.
· Provide technical support to Operations where necessary for complex problems.
· May have the responsibility for the project management of control systems and software based projects.

· Actively adopt and promote a strong cultural Credo based code of conduct prominent at Johnson & Johnson. Ensure effective closure on Quality System documents (Audit Actions, NCR’s, CAPA’s, CR’s, etc).
· Ensure that all activity is carried out in accordance with both internal and external Health and Safety and Environmental standards for both new and existing installations.
· Works with manager / team leader to develop and implement strategic engineering Goals & Objectives.
· Support the implementation of all engineering and plant strategic initiatives
· May be required to:
· Monitor project plans and schedules to ensure deliverables on time and within budget.
· Identify and manage internal and external resources to support assigned projects.
· Monitor and analyze opportunities for the development of new or improved tools for process improvement activities.
· Provide technical expertise as a subject matter expert.
· Provide moderately complex technical consultation and leadership to multidisciplinary teams.
· Provide training and mentoring to less experienced staff.
· Identify and lead cost and technical improvements under the departments’ continuous improvement program.
Education and Experience Required for Role
Essential:
· Third level degree qualification in software engineering or equivalent
· Demonstrate solid understanding of software systems
· Strong Analytical and Problem solving skills
· Ability to work on own initiative
· Strong communication skills
· Attention to detail
Desirable:
· Graduate 5 years experience

job_title: 【Surgical Vision / AMO】Senior Supply Chain Demand Planner
job_description: The Demand Planner position is responsible for developing and communicating a consensus forecast for a defined portfolio of products.

The Demand Planner is responsible to integrate historical data, market data, & strategic plans collected throughout the S&OP; Process by close collaboration with sales, marketing, finance, and regional & global supply chain partners.
Inventory and supply management are also key functions, as the Demand Planner is expected to manage high service levels while maintaining optimal inventory levels.
Key Demand Planner functions include:
1. Interact regularly with cross-functional/regional partners including Marketing, Sales Strategy, Sales Operations, Finance, Regional & Global Planning
2. Develop SKU-level operational forecasts
3. Lead local S&OP; process to ensure consistency between consensus forecast and business plan
4. Work with regional teams to ensure promotions, special events and programs are incorporated into regional forecast submissions.
5. Create scenario plans to support on-time launch of new products
6. Work with regional commercial, finance, CLS partners to improve overall demand planning process through shared supply chain/ commercial accountability
7. Optimize inventory to avoid stock outs while reducing slow-moving inventory and scrap
8. Meet KPI targets (Inventory/LIFR/SLOB/MAPE) and find ways to improve versus those targets
The position will be measured primarily on:
KPI targets (Inventory/LIFR/SLOB/MAPE/etc.)Leadership by behaviors (Collaboration/Alignment/Execution/Facilitation/Innovation/etc.)
KPI targets (Inventory/LIFR/SLOB/MAPE/etc.)
Leadership by behaviors (Collaboration/Alignment/Execution/Facilitation/Innovation/etc.)
• Bachelor’s degree
• 3+ years of experience in a supply chain role, preferably planning
• Ability to communicate clearly and concisely in English and Japanese
• Knowledge of Microsoft office, particularly Excel
• Knowledge of SAP or similar ERP systems is a plus; APICS certification is a plus
• Big picture oriented thinking and strong leadership, influence, and interpersonal skills
• Analytical and process oriented, with strong critical thinking / problem-solving skills
• Results oriented and able to independently create and deliver; self-starter / entrepreneurial mindset

job_description: 過去５年以内において、病気（病気の治療に伴う症状を含みます。）を原因として、又は原因は明らかでないが、意識を失ったことがある。
過去５年以内において、病気を原因として、身体の全部又は一部 が、一時的に思い通りに動かせなくなったことがある。
過去５年以内において、十分な睡眠時間を取っているにもかかわらず、日中、活動している最中に眠り込こんでしまった回数が週３回 以上となったことがある。
過去１年以内において、次のいずれかに該当したことがある。 ・飲酒を繰り返し、絶えず体にアルコールが入っている状態を３日 以上続けたことが３回以上ある。 ・病気の治療のため、医師から飲酒をやめるよう助言を受けている にもかかわらず、飲酒したことが３回以上ある。
病気を理由として、医師から、運転免許の取得又は運転を控えるよう助言を受けている。
